# Hot Updater Documentation

Hot Updater is a self-hostable OTA (Over-The-Air) updates solution for React Native apps.

## Documentation Structure

### Build Plugins

- ["Bare (CLI) Plugin"](https://hot-updater.dev/docs/build-plugins/bare) - Use hot-updater with React Native CLI
- ["Expo Plugin"](https://hot-updater.dev/docs/build-plugins/expo) - Use hot-updater with Expo
- ["Rock Plugin"](https://hot-updater.dev/docs/build-plugins/rock) - Use hot-updater with Rock

### Concepts

- ["How does it work?"](https://hot-updater.dev/docs/concepts/how-it-works) - Understanding the core infrastructure and update decision logic
- ["Plugin System"](https://hot-updater.dev/docs/concepts/plugin-system) - Customize Hot Updater with build, storage, and database plugins

### Database Plugins

- ["AWS S3 Database"](https://hot-updater.dev/docs/database-plugins/aws) - Use aws database with hot-updater
- ["Cloudflare D1 Database"](https://hot-updater.dev/docs/database-plugins/cloudflare) - Use cloudflare database with hot-updater
- ["Firestore Database"](https://hot-updater.dev/docs/database-plugins/firestore) - Use Firebase Firestore database with hot-updater
- ["Supabase Database"](https://hot-updater.dev/docs/database-plugins/supabase) - Use Supabase database with hot-updater

### Get Started

- ["Basic Usage"](https://hot-updater.dev/docs/get-started/basic-usage) - Learn how to configure and integrate hot-updater into your React Native project
- ["Introduction"](https://hot-updater.dev/docs/get-started/introduction) - Self-hostable OTA updates for React Native apps as an alternative to CodePush

### Guides

- ["Channels"](https://hot-updater.dev/docs/guides/channel-management) - Manage updates across different environments and user groups
- ["Compression Strategy"](https://hot-updater.dev/docs/guides/compression) - Choose a compression format for your bundle distribution
- ["Console (Rollback & Force Update)"](https://hot-updater.dev/docs/guides/console) - Opens a localhost server for rollback, force updates, and git history access
- ["Deploy"](https://hot-updater.dev/docs/guides/deploy) - Deploy updates to specified platforms using the hot-updater CLI
- ["Simulate Release Mode"](https://hot-updater.dev/docs/guides/simulator-test) - Test hot-updater in Release mode on simulators

### Integration Plugins

- ["Datadog"](https://hot-updater.dev/docs/integration-plugins/datadog) - Upload source maps to Datadog for error tracking
- ["Re.Pack"](https://hot-updater.dev/docs/integration-plugins/repack) - Integration plugin for Re.Pack bundler
- ["Sentry"](https://hot-updater.dev/docs/integration-plugins/sentry) - Upload source maps to Sentry for error tracking

### Managed-Hosted

- ["AWS S3 Storage + Lambda@Edge Function"](https://hot-updater.dev/docs/managed-providers/aws) - Set up hot-updater with AWS S3 and Lambda@Edge
- ["Cloudflare Provider"](https://hot-updater.dev/docs/managed-providers/cloudflare) - Set up hot-updater with Cloudflare R2 and D1
- ["Firebase Provider"](https://hot-updater.dev/docs/managed-providers/firebase) - Set up hot-updater with Firebase Storage and Firestore
- ["Supabase Provider"](https://hot-updater.dev/docs/managed-providers/supabase) - Set up hot-updater with Supabase Storage and Database

### Policy

- ["When to Submit Your App for Review"](https://hot-updater.dev/docs/policy/app-review) - Understanding when app store review is required vs HotUpdater updates
- ["Security"](https://hot-updater.dev/docs/policy/security) - Best practices for protecting plugin tokens and sensitive data

### React Native API

- ["addEventListener"](https://hot-updater.dev/docs/react-native-api/addListener) - Listen to update events
- ["checkForUpdate"](https://hot-updater.dev/docs/react-native-api/checkForUpdate) - Check if updates are available
- ["getChannel"](https://hot-updater.dev/docs/react-native-api/getChannel) - Get the current update channel
- ["isUpdateDownloaded"](https://hot-updater.dev/docs/react-native-api/isUpdateDownloaded) - Check if update has been downloaded
- ["reload"](https://hot-updater.dev/docs/react-native-api/reload) - Reload the app with the updated bundle

### Self-Hosted

- ["Self-Hosted Overview"](https://hot-updater.dev/docs/self-hosted/overview) - Overview of self-hosted hot-updater deployment
- ["Self-Hosted Provider"](https://hot-updater.dev/docs/self-hosted/setup) - Deploy hot-updater on your own infrastructure

### Storage Plugins

- ["AWS S3 Storage"](https://hot-updater.dev/docs/storage-plugins/aws) - Use aws storage with hot-updater
- ["Cloudflare R2 Storage"](https://hot-updater.dev/docs/storage-plugins/cloudflare) - Use Cloudflare R2 storage with hot-updater
- ["Firebase Storage"](https://hot-updater.dev/docs/storage-plugins/firebase) - Use Firebase Storage with hot-updater
- ["Supabase Storage"](https://hot-updater.dev/docs/storage-plugins/supabase) - Use Supabase storage with hot-updater


## Quick Links

- Getting Started: https://hot-updater.dev/docs/get-started/introduction
- API Reference: https://hot-updater.dev/docs/react-native-api/wrap
- Managed Providers: https://hot-updater.dev/docs/managed-providers/supabase

For full documentation, see: https://hot-updater.dev/docs
